tool.name: Lefse

param.name: design
param.label: design - assigns groups to sets
param.help: design has 2 columns: group(col 1) and grouping(col 2) (separated by a TAB character) use make.design

param.name: sets
param.label: sets - Which of the sets in your design file you would like to analyze?
param.help: separate sets by dashes or commas, e.g. set1,set2 or set1-set2-set3

param.name: class
param.label: class -indicate the which category you would like used for the Kruskal Wallis analysis
param.help: If none is provided first category is used

param.name: sclass
param.label: subclass - indicate the which category you would like used for the Kruskal Wallis analysis
param.help: If none is provided second category is used

param.name: aalpha
param.label: aalpha - alpha value for the Krukal Wallis Anova test

param.name: walpha
param.label: walpha - alpha value for the Wilcoxon test

param.name: lda
param.label: lda - threshold on the absolute value of the logarithmic LDA score

param.name: iters
param.label: iters - number of bootstrap iteration for LDA

param.name: fboots
param.label: fboots - set the subsampling fraction value for each bootstrap iteration

param.name: strict
param.label: strict - set the multiple testing correction options
param.help: 0 no correction (more strict, default), 1 correction for independent comparisons, 2 correction for independent comparison

param.name: minc
param.label: minc - minimum number of samples per subclass for performing wilcoxon test

param.name: wilc
param.label: wilc - indicate whether to perform the Wilcoxon test

param.name: curv
param.label: curv - whether perform the wilcoxon testing the Curtis's approach (beta)

param.name: norm
param.label: norm - multiply relative abundances by 1000000
param.help: Recommended when very low values are present
